大学英语精读单词表(第一册) - 豆丁网 ... parcel n. 包裹 reluctantly ad. 不情愿地，勉强地 reluctant a. 不顾的，勉强的.
She reluctantly went back to bed., 她无奈地会去睡觉.
friends&nbsp;103&nbsp;生词_(A櫅gc_新浪博客 ... wince 畏缩 reluctantly 不情愿的 tray 盘子, 托盘.

list.abs: The king ' s chief steward reluctantly agreed to a trial., 国王的首席管家勉强同意试用.
Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage ., 她父亲勉强地答应了这桩婚姻.
忍 - 搜搜百科 ... 忍受[ bear;endure;stand] 忍痛[ very reluctantly] 忍无可忍[ last straw].
Shimei said to me , very reluctantly Line of Duty , I really alternative , I could not stand , and I determined to move out .师妹很无奈地对我说：“师姐，我实在是迫不得已，我忍受不住了，我坚决要搬走。”
I did not fancy the idea and I reluctantly followed Robert out of the room ., 我并不喜欢这个主意 , 所以我勉强跟着罗伯特走进了起居室.

entry.def: If you are reluctant to do something, you are unwilling to do it and hesitate before doing it, or do it slowly and without enthusiasm.

example.ex: Mr Spero was reluctant to ask for help...
example.tran: 斯佩罗先生不愿意寻求帮助。

example.ex: The police are very reluctant to get involved in this sort of thing.
example.tran: 警方很不愿意卷入这类事情。

auth_sentence.content: So he reluctantly gave me absolution of my sins.
auth_sentence.res_content: So he reluctantly gave me absolution of my sins.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So he reluctantly gave me absolution of my sins.

auth_sentence.content: Ryba reluctantly obeyed, but he was soon fired.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ryba reluctantly obeyed, but he was soon fired.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ryba reluctantly obeyed, but he was soon fired.

sentences.en: He reluctantly conceded that he was not fit enough to play in the match.
sentences.cn: 他不情愿地承认自己的状态不足以应付这场比赛。

sentences.en: He thought for a moment,then reluctantly agreed.
sentences.cn: 他思量了一下,才勉强同意了。
